---
title: "Initialize RollApp"
slug: initialize-adv
---

### Initialization

Initializing the configuration files of the RollApp will create the necessary information to start a new RollApp. This will create a folder `~/.roller` in the root directory of your computer with important files such as the `Genesis` file.

Developers have two options for initializing the configuration files, an interactive guide or by using CLI flags:

`````mdx-code-block
import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

````mdx-code-block

<Tabs groupId="guide">
<TabItem value="Interactive guide" label="Interactive guide">

```
roller config init --interactive
```

<details>
<summary>Interactive guide breakdown</summary>

<div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Select your network</summary>
    <div>
            <details>
                <summary>Devnet (default)</summary>
                <div>Non-incentivized public Devnet for building and testing</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>Local</summary>
                <div>Uses localhost Dymension Hub node and mock DA network</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>Froopyland</summary>
                <div>Very Soon</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>Mainnet</summary>
                <div>Soon</div>
            </details>
    </div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Enter your RollApp ID</summary>
        <div><b>Format</b>: name_ID-version (e.g wagmi_420-1)</div><br/>
            <details>
                <summary>Name</summary>
                <div>Lowercase English letters</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>ID</summary>
                <div>1 to 5 digit number representing the EIP155 Chain-ID of the RollApp</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>Version</summary>
                <div>1 to 5 digit number representing the version</div>
            </details>
        <div><i>  Please note the "_" after the name and the "-" after the ID, these are required for EVM RollApps</i></div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Specify your RollApp denom</summary>
        <div>e.g BTC, PEPE, DYM</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Set the genesis token supply</summary>
        <div>How many tokens do you wish to mint for Genesis? This is the initial token supply in the RollApp (default: 1,000,000,000). </div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Choose your data layer</summary>
        <div>Defaults to Celestia Mocha network, with more DA added soon.</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>Select your execution environment</summary>
        <div>
            <details>
                <summary>EVM (Default)</summary>
                <div>Standard EVM environment utilizing Ethermint built by EVMOS</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>RDK</summary>
                <div>Custom application binary. Requires specifying runtime binary path (e.g. /usr/local/bin/rollappd)</div>
            </details>
        </div>
    </details>
</div>


</div>
</details>


</TabItem>
<TabItem value="Flags" label="Flags">

```
roller config init <ROLLAPP-ID> <DENOM>
```

<details>
<summary>Flags breakdown</summary>

<div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>rollapp-id</summary>
        <div><b>Format</b>: name_ID-version (e.g wagmi_420-1)</div><br/>
            <details>
                <summary>Name</summary>
                <div>Lowercase English letters</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>ID</summary>
                <div>1 to 5 digit number representing the EIP155 Chain-ID of the RollApp</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>Version</summary>
                <div>1 to 5 digit number representing the version</div>
            </details>
        <div><i>  Please note the "_" after the name and the "-" after the ID, these are required for EVM RollApps</i></div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>denom</summary>
        <div>e.g BTC, PEPE, DYM</div>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>hub-version (optional)</summary>
            <details>
                <summary>Devnet (default)</summary>
                <div>Non-incentivized public Devnet for building and testing</div>
            </details>
            <details>
                <summary>Local</summary>
                <div>Uses localhost Dymension Hub node and mock DA network</div>
            </details>
    </details>
</div>

<div>
    <details>
    <summary>token-supply (optional)</summary>
        <div>How many tokens do you wish to mint for Genesis? This is the initial token supply in the RollApp (default: 1,000,000,000). </div>
    </details>
</div>

</div>
</details>

</TabItem>

</Tabs>
`````

### Address funding

After initializing the RollApp, addresses to fund should be returned to you:

```
ðŸ”‘ Addresses:

Sequencer | Address used to publish state updates to the Dymension Hub
Relayer   | Address that handles the relaying of IBC packets
Celestia  | Address used to publish data on-chain to the DA network
```

In Dymension's [discord](https://discord.gg/dymension) please fund the addresses in the `faucet` channel with the following command as an example:

```
$REQUEST dym15ad5y52e3zx784hl0b4uyw5huctktwty2dq2vn devnet_304-1
$REQUEST dym1j968h4avztqmgeh3bn4p2tfh4ptxp055e056sy devnet_304-1
```

You can then check the balance of the address with:

```
$BALANCES dym15ad5y52e3zx784hl0b4uyw5huctktwty2dq2vn
```

Now that we've funded the Dymension wallets, let's fund the Celestia Mocha wallet for data publication. In Celestia's [discord](https://discord.com/invite/YsnTPcSfWQ)
please go to the `mocha-faucet` and request tokens with the following command as an example:

```
$request celestia1wnqasu0vze3qn8jldv9hx4yhf5w59l080u5mg0
```

Now that we've funded the wallets we can go ahead and register the RollApp!
